New titles from Wilbur Smith, Susan Hill, Cathy Kelly and more

2017 Quick Reads arrive in Suffolk

Written by Brandon King · Published Jan 23, 2017

With one in six adults still struggling to read, Quick Reads continues its work to break down the barriers to reading. Since its launch, Quick Reads has distributed over 4.5m books and there have been over 3.5m library loans.

Alice Through the Looking Glass

Written by Brandon King · Published May 24, 2016

The new Alice Through the Looking Glass film, released by Walt Disney Pictures on May 27 2016, is based on Through the Looking-Glass by Lewis Carroll and is the sequel to the 2010 film Alice in Wonderland. In honour of the latest film, here are some Alice related books and DVDs to investigate.

Written by Emma Raindle · Published May 3, 2016

William Shakespeare: Celebrating his 400th anniversary

Written by Brandon King · Published Mar 2, 2016

Shakespeare Week runs from 14-20 March. Take a look at how the Bard has influenced books, film and music until the modern day.

New fiction for March 2016

Written by Brandon King · Published Mar 1, 2016

Anticipated new novels from L. S. Hilton, Wilbur Smith and Tracy Chevalier.

8 classic challenging reads

Written by Brandon King · Published Feb 18, 2016

The recent BBC TV adaptation of Leo Tolstoy’s War and peace has led to a surge of interest in classic titles. If you enjoyed War and peace why not try one of the following ‘challenging’ reads?

Quick Reads for 2016

Written by Brandon King · Published Jan 21, 2016

Quick Reads, the publisher of short accessible titles written by popular authors, celebrates its 10th anniversary this year.
